physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest X-ray showed increased infiltration in the right lower lobe.
Intubated due to further respiratory decline.
Patient was extubated; developed severe weakness and numbness in both legs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weakness and numbness started to disappear.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cranial nerves intact; muscle power examination showed weakness in lower limbs: 4/5 hip flexion and extension, 3-4/5 knee extension, 2/5 knee flexion, 1/5 ankle dorsiflexion, 2/5 ankle plantar flexion, and mild weakness in hands. Ankle jerks absent; other tendon reflexes preserved.
Follow-up showed minimal weakness in knee flexion and mild weakness in foot dorsiflexion and plantar flexion. Normal sensations except for mild numbness in right toes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement observed in neurologic status.
